main event: Multiple witnesses observed a vivid blue round object with sharp red exhaust hovering stationary in the sky before passing out of sight below the horizon.
interesting points: The object was the size of a B-29 aircraft and had a vivid blue color with sharp red exhaust, which is unusual for conventional aircraft or known objects.
The sighting occurred at 2200 CDT on 23 June 1952, lasting 1.5 to 2 minutes, and was observed by several people, adding to the credibility of the report.
The object appeared to be two miles east on a general course from northeast to south before it was lost to sight, indicating controlled movement.

A civilian weather observer from a Madison newspaper reported a similar sighting of a huge motor with a purplish-yellow tail crossing from south to northwest, adding further corroboration to the event.
Despite multiple witnesses and newspaper reports, no investigation action was taken, and no photographs were known to have been taken of the object.
sighted object: vivid blue round object with sharp red exhaust
